articles.title: ECIV 340L Project
articles.contents:
Contents
PROJECT PROBLEM STATEMENT
PROJECT TASKS:
1. Reading (20%)
2. Site Selection (0%)
3. Data Collection and Data Analysis (50%)
5. Presentation and Submission (30%)


PROJECT PROBLEM STATEMENT
The ECIV 340L company has hired three surveying company to find the topography of three existing routes. The three companies: Yellow, Blue, and Red are assigned three routes as shown in the Site Selection section. The aim is to find elevations at 20 feet interval along the routes. In addition, the companies are required to use at least one turning point (TP) along the designated routes. The BM information is provided in the Site Selection section. The deliverables from each of these companies are:
A final Presentation including:
detail methodology of data collection
summary of the topography of the routes

A final report:
only providing a detailed engineering drawing of the profile along the route

PROJECT TASKS:
1. Reading (20%)
Profile Leveling
2. Site Selection (0%)
Project Site: YELLOWProject Site: BLUEProject Site: REDProject Site: Benchmark-1 (BM-1)Project Site: Benchmark-2 (BM-2)3. Data Collection and Data Analysis (50%)
To collect data, schedule a time to reserve equipment via email: ahmedf@email.sc.edu Your email should include the following information:
provide a list of equipment you need
indicate when are you going to pick up equipment
indicate when are you planning to do the project work
indicated when are you going to return the equipment

Prepare a data form. The data form will be similar to lab session related to contouring
5. Presentation and Submission (30%)

articles.title: ECIV 340L Project
articles.contents:
Contents
ECIV 340L Project (Spring
2022)

ECIV 340L Project (Spring
2022)
We have been retained by a civil engineering firm, Columbia, LLC, to
conduct a traffic analysis of individual intersections in proximity of
department of CEE at the University of South Carolina (UofSC). The map
shows the intersections of interest.
Project SiteOur subcontract stipulates that we will provide technical memoranda.
The tech memo should provide the following information.
Reconnaissance: CAD‐drawn (AutoCAD or
MicroStation or other suitable soft) plan view of the assigned
intersection showing:
Curb‐to‐curb dimensions of all approaches (units should be in
feet and inches.
Lane and channelization markings.
Traffic control at the intersection

Data Collection:
Traffic volume counts during should be done in peak traffic periods.
Group BLUE : Collect data for Morning Peak
(7.30-9.30AM)
Group RED : Collect data for Evening peak
(4.30-6.30AM)

Volumes showing numbers of cars, trucks, and buses making through,
left, and right turn movements Volumes should be recorded for each
15‐minute interval during each hour.
Traffic counts should be collected on a “typical” day; thus, they
should be done on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Avoid doing
traffic counts on Mondays and Fridays. A traffic count template is
provided in the TMC lab session.

Capacity analyses:
Present level of service (LOS) for existing traffic condition and
traffic control using HCS 2010 and Synchro. Compare results (e.g.,
delay) from both software.
Analyze the LOS in Synchro if traffic control at the intersection
is (i) TWSC and (ii) Roundabout
Discuss the following:
What is the best traffic control for the intersection and
why?
Describe any bicycle or pedestrian issues that you believe are
problematic.


The tech memo should be brief, but must contain sufficient text to
clearly explain and convey to the reader the information it
contains.
Tech memo is due from each team on TBA.

articles.title: COVID-19 Guidelines
articles.contents:
Guidelines from University:
In accordance with university policy, you are required to wear a mask upon entering the building. Masks will need to stay on during class.
Follow detailed guideline from university website
Guidelines for ECIV 340L class:
The ECIV 340L course is taught face-to-face and the students work in group. Thus, the students are encouraged to adhere to these guidelines:
Use FACE MASKS when in the building and while working in a group. Face Masks (one-time use) can be provided upon request or they might be placed in-class.
Use hand gloves when using the lab equipment, HAND GLOVES will be provided in each class by the instructor
Maintain social distancing while interaction with other students/instructors, as much as possible

articles.title: Transportation Engineering Laboratory
articles.description:
ECIV 340L   
Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering    
University of South Carolina
articles.contents:
Course Description
This course aims to provide students with sound data collection and
analysis techniques. This course is intended to complement the materials
covered in Introduction to Transportation Engineering (ECIV 340), with
emphasis on field experience.
Learning Outcomes
At the conclusion of this course, students should be able to:
Collect necessary traffic data to support traffic impact studies
and transportation planning studies.
Make field book entry and perform engineering calculations in
proper format using self-measured data.
Write engineering reports.
Prerequisites/Co-Requisites
Students must either have previously completed ECIV 340 or take ECIV
340 in the same semester as this course (ECIV 340L). Students are
expected to be proficient with Microsoft Excel. The prerequisite for the
class are ECIV 101 and STAT 509.
Useful References
1. “Introduction to Traffic Engineering: A Manual for data Collection
and Analysis” 2nd edition by Thomas R. Currin. Cengage Learning,
2013.
“Elementary Surveying: An Introduction to Geomatics” 14th edition by
Charles D. Ghilani and Paul R. Wolf. Prentice Hall, 2015.
